result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose E. Garcia Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater, Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to 11CF885 and any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $300 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Huber and Work Crew authorized, but DE is not eligible for the ELM per the Court.
Court financial obligations have been paid in full.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Jose E. Garcia, appeared with Attorney Douglas Ivan Henderson.  Clerk: PT
Sentencting arguments made.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years Consecutive to 11CF885 and any other sentence.  See conditions.  Court imposes a fine of $300 plus costs & surcharge.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied and if any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Sentencing moved up to 3/18/16 at 10:30 AM
Email correspondence received from Atty Henderson requesting to move up sentencing date since parties mutually agree to waive PSI.
$2500 deposited on 2/16/16
At the request of Atty Henderson, bond motion that is set for today at 11:00 may be removed from the calendar.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Douglas Henderson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion, to be read in.  Count 1 - Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation waived by parties.  Sentencing 4/13/16 at 10:30.  Bond continued.

Defendant Jose E. Garcia appeared with Attorney Douglas Ivan Henderson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:40 am.
